example.name: bellringing!
example.text: Proper English bells are started off in "rounds," from the highest-pitched bell to the lowest.
example.arg: in "rounds," from the highest-pitched bell to the lowest.
example.note: Rounds is not strictly only a descending scale, but more properly any sequence of bells in sorted order by pitch; it needn't be a scale, since the sequence can skip a note in the scale depending on the population of the tower, and it needn't be descending. Ascending sequences (from lowest bell to highest) are only used to signal the death of a monarch, however. Gawd, I am such a geek.
